Permutation-based step-wise searching

Source: R/search.R
null.search.Rd

Performs permutation-based significance testing of step-wise search results.

null.search(
  ranking = NULL,
  ES,
  nperm = 1000,
  plot = TRUE,
  obs.best.score = NULL,
  cache.path = NULL,
  smooth = TRUE,
  return.perm.pval = FALSE,
  seed = 123,
  ncores = 1,
  ...
)

Arguments

ranking

a vector containing rankings for sample ordering. Default is NULL. If NULL, we assume the ESet is already ranked. This is used only to compute the observed stepwise search score, if not provided

ES

an ordered expression set object with the same sample ordering and features as processed by the stepwise.search() function when performing a step-wise heuristic search

nperm

an integer specifying the number of permutations to perform. Default = 1000

plot

logical indicating whether or not to plot the emperical null distribution with the observed score and permutation p-value

obs.best.score

a numeric value corresponding to the observed (best) stepwise search score to use for permutation based p-value computation. Default is NULL. If set to NULL, we compute the observed score given the ranking variable and ESet

cache.path

full path to permutation-based (null) score distributions cache files. If a permutation for a given dataset (and dependent search variables such as 'N') exist, we recycle values instead of re-computing them to save time. Default is NULL. If NULL, cache path is set to the default ~/.Rcache for future cache loading.

smooth

logical indicating whether or not to smoothen the p-value calculation to avoid p-value of 0. Default is TRUE

return.perm.pval

logical indicating whether or not to return the permutation-based p-value computed by the function. Default is FALSE

seed

seed set for permutation. Default = 123

ncores

number of cores to use, if using parallelization for permutation testing. Default = 1

...

additional parameters passed to the stepwise.seach() function, which will be applied to each permutation run (called within topn.eval())

Value

If return.perm.pval is set to TRUE, will return the permutation p-value

Contents

Developed by Vinay Kartha, Stefano Monti, Reina Chau, Katia Bulekova.
